text:
When viewing a blog tag listing i.e. at `<http://myblog.com/tag/tag-slug|myblog.com/tag/tag-slug>`,
is there a built-in page variable to get that individual tag-slug, or do I need to regex (or similar) for the tag-slug in `request.full_url`?

Essentially I’d like to be able to style up the relevant tag from a tag filter list differently, to show an active state.

<@UJJQP7UB0> I haven’t tried this but from looking at the developer info on one of our blogs, it looks like the info is accessible through content_tags on the page so you could hopefully access it with {{ content_tags.name }}

Thanks David, unfortunately that looks like it returns all the tags associated with the page content as articles may have multiple tags applied. I’m trying to get at the singular tag used for the url path.

<@UJJQP7UB0> aah yea sorry, I have just tried it with a different tag and I can see multiples this time. I can’t see anything else helpful in the developer info unfortunately. Sorry I can’t be of more help!
